      protected boolean doesDisconnect(GreyscaleImage input, int col, int row)

      protected boolean hasImmediateFourNeighbors(GreyscaleImage input, int col, int row)
      this assumes that the invoker has checked that (col, row) has 1 pixel to each side and 1 above and below.
      protected boolean isTheEndOfAOnePixelLine(GreyscaleImage input, int col, int row)
      return true if this endpoint (col, row) is the end of a line that has a width of 1 pixel.

      void setDebug(boolean setToDebug)
      turn on the extra output to help debugging.
      void useLineDrawingMode()
      for images which are already line drawings, that is images such as maps with only lines, or for block images, use this to avoid a gap filling stage that fills single pixel gaps surrounded by non-zero pixels.

    • Method Detail

      • useLineDrawingMode

        public void useLineDrawingMode()
        for images which are already line drawings, that is images such as maps with only lines, or for block images, use this to avoid a gap filling stage that fills single pixel gaps surrounded by non-zero pixels. (Else, the filter applies such a gap filling algorithm to help avoid creating bubbles in thick lines).

      • setDebug

        public void setDebug(boolean setToDebug)
        Description copied from interface: ILineThinner
        turn on the extra output to help debugging. this includes plot displays with awt, html output and additional logging

      • applyFilter

        public void applyFilter(GreyscaleImage input)
        Description copied from interface: ILineThinner
        apply the filter
        Parameters:
        input - the input image (it's modified internally)

      • prefillGapsSurroundedByNeighbors

        protected void prefillGapsSurroundedByNeighbors(GreyscaleImage input)
        instead of dilation, just fill in any gaps that have 4 neighbors already filled in. This should not act upon many pixels.
        Parameters:
        input -

      • doesDisconnect

        protected boolean doesDisconnect(GreyscaleImage input,
                     int col,
                     int row)
        for the full 8 neighbor region, determine whether nulling the pixel at (col, row) would disconnect the remaining line. Note that the boolean logic is embedded in the comments. One should be able to combine the rules for multiple pixel tests to reduce the redundant comparisons for the regions in common.
        Parameters:
        input -
        col -
        row -
        Returns:

      • isTheEndOfAOnePixelLine

        protected boolean isTheEndOfAOnePixelLine(GreyscaleImage input,
